feed.title: JHM Lab.
feed.subtitle: Optimal Transport, Topology of Singularities, Physics.

entry.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (3/4).

link.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (3/4).

entry.summary: In Part 3/4 of our critical review of SR we examine the homogeneous wave equation and its properties under Lorentz transformations.

entry.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (2/4).

link.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (2/4).

entry.summary: In Part 2/4 of our critical review of SR we discuss the errors in Einstein's famous spherical wavefront proof. Ultimately we argue that the Law of Propagation of Light (A2) is not Lorentz invariant, contrary to Einstein's claims. The error is subtle.

entry.title: Fundamentos de Relatividad Especial y Propagacion de la Luz en el Vacio. Una revision critica. (1/4).

link.title: Fundamentos de Relatividad Especial y Propagacion de la Luz en el Vacio. Una revision critica. (1/4).

entry.summary: Estamos comenzando a publicar nuestro ensayo sobre la Relatividad Especial (SR). El ensayo es una revision critica de los fundamentos de la RS. Presentamos el articulo en varias partes. En esta primera parte, simplemente abordamos los supuestos basicos de la RS, Transformaciones de Lorentz, y el cono nulo.

entry.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (1/4).

link.title: Foundations of Special Relativity and Light Propagation in Vacuum. A Critical Review (1/4).

entry.summary: We are beginning to publish our essay on Special Relativity (SR). The essay is a critical review of the foundations of SR. We present the paper in several parts. In this first part, we simply address the basic assumptions of SR, Lorentz transformations, and the null cone.

entry.title: Espozo d’un Argumento Sobre P contra NP

link.title: Espozo d’un Argumento Sobre P contra NP

entry.summary: Aquí esbozamos un argumento para demostrar que $P$ no es igual a $NP$. Todas las ideas se basan en discusiones con C.A. Feinstein.
